meanings.definition: A brief sound or light signal
meanings.sent1: I heard a blip coming from the computer.
meanings.sent2: The radar screen showed a blip indicating an incoming aircraft.
meanings.sent3: The blip from the microwave signaled that my popcorn was ready.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a blip of joy in the quiet room.
meanings.sent5: The blip of the fire alarm made everyone evacuate quickly.

meanings.sent1: There was a blip of paint on the wall.
meanings.sent2: The map had a blip marking the location of the treasure.
meanings.sent3: She noticed a blip of chocolate on his cheek after he ate a cookie.
meanings.sent4: The blip of red on the canvas added a pop of color to the painting.
meanings.sent5: The blip of ink on the paper made it look messy.

meanings.sent1: The blip in the stock market caused a stir among investors.
meanings.sent2: A blip in the heart rate monitor made the nurse check on the patient.
meanings.sent3: The blip in the road made the car jump a little.
meanings.sent4: His mood had a blip of excitement before the disappointment set in.
meanings.sent5: The blip in the weather forecast changed everyone's plans.
